width: butt 33.3; neck 20.7; sh. 65.5; ric. 32.0; break 36.0; rivet 4.0-4.4
surface: V. fine dark green patina; hilt repair tends to have a slightly brighter colour.
description: Dimensions: EL 134.5mm; W butt 33.3; W neck 20.7; Wsh. 65.5; W ric. 32.0; W break 36.0; Wt. 159.3g; W rivet 4.0-4.4; Tbl 9.6; B fg. 10.5,Typology: rivet section square with flattened angles (-octagonal); crisp upstanding flanges & neatly flattened ricassos; omega hilt-line preserved as scratch marks on both faces.,Manufacture: at least one side, possibly both, of original hilt were given transverse keying groove prior to casting on the repair; latter is much thicker and more amorphous with flow lines, except where heavily ground on sides; slot in repair is only an indent with a 'bar' across it; many fine grinding marks on blade and shoulders,Condition: fair edges but not very sharp; slight profile bend at break.
remarks: PIF (sketch over); Rec: SN March 95; Source: Sb.A.

collection: Warwick County Museum,Mus. No. A.196,Previously Earl of Aylesford
site: England,County: Warwickshire,Town or parish: Meridan,Details of find unknown. Sword was presented to Warwickshire Natural History and Archaeological Society in June 1852 by the Earl of Aylesford.
toSearch: Meriden, Coventry, West Midlands, UK
other: Length: 22.5 in. = 571.5mm,Width: 1.75 in = 44.45mm (just below hilt),Thickness: 0.3 in. = 7.62mm (just below hilt)
description: Leaf shaped blade and straight shoulders, slight swelling in outline of grip, widest part nearest shoulder. Two rivet holes on one shoulder, but metal broken away on other shoulder at rivet holes. One rivet hole in hilt set i longitudinal groove; within same groove a dimple (mid-way between hole and widening for shoulder) perhaps for another hole which had not been perforated. The groove forks below dimple, but is deeper on side of surviving shoulder rivet holes. At junction of hilt and shoulder side pressure has pressed edges up slightly. Blade, an elongated oval, broken at 9.4 in. (238.76mm) from tip: pieces fit together. Outer face (.5mm) in many places flaked off, but surviving surface and metal appears stable.
publications: 1. 17th Annual Report of the Warwickshire Natural History and Archaeological Society, April, 1853, p. 3.,2. F. W. Shotton, Proc. Coventry Natural History and Scientific Society, vol. U, 1938, pp. 190 & 191.

collection: Warwick County Museum,Mus. No. A.195,Previously Earl of Aylesford

other: Length: 20.7 in. = 525.78mm,Width: 1.6 in. = 40.64mm,Thickness: 0.35 in. = 8.89mm at base of hilt
description: Leaf shaped blade, shoulders curving slightly to blade. Elongated holes on shoulders appear to have been each a pair of rivet holes, with outer edge on one shoulder partly, on other completely gone. Blade an elongated oval, tip missing about 3/4 inch and broken across at 7.85 in. from surviving end: pieces fit together. Rather more than 1/2 of grip and pommel missing.Outer face (.5mm) in many places flaked off, but surviving surface and metal appear stable.
publications: 1. 17th Annual Report of the Warwickshire Natural History and Archaeological Society, April 1853, p. 3.,2. F. W. Shotton, Proc: Coventry Natural History and Scientific Society, Vol. I, 1938, pp. 190 + 191.
